note.p: Education: Queen Elizabeth Grammar School, Wakefield
Career: Travelled to Holland, where he learned the language; Hydrographer to Charles II; planned a canal from the River Thames to the River Severn
Left off PL for 1682 for non-payment of arrears
References: Graham Jagger, 'Joseph Moxon, FRS, and the Royal Society' in NR 1995 vol 49 pp 193-208
Michael Hunter, 'The Social Bias and Changing Fortunes of an Early Scientific Institution: An Analysis of the Membership of the Royal Society, 1660-1685' in NR 1976-7 vol 31 pp 9-114
R Lewis, 'The publication of John Wilkins's Essay (1668): some contextual considerations' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp133-146
Notes: DNB gives year of death as 1700, as does Hunter. In index to BR is ref to Davis and Carter (eds), Mechanick exercises ... 682.2.
